title.narrative: PROG 2017-2021_Outcome3_La sécurité alimentaire et nutritionnelle des ménages et communautés vulnérables aux chocs de changement climatique, à la marginalisation et à la migration de détresse, est renforcée par la promotion d'une agriculture climato-intelligente et de livelihoods diversifiés dans les districts de Irob et Enderta (Eastern et Southeastern Tigray), Ethiopie.

PROG 2017-2021_Outcome3_Strengthening food and nutrition security of targeted households and communities vulnerable to climate change hazards, marginalization and distress migration through promotion of climate-smart agriculture and diversified livelihoods in the districts of Irob and Enderta (Eastern and Southeastern Tigray), Ethiopia.

description.narrative: Caritas International's program for Ethiopia seeks to strengthen food and nutrition security of 3,734 households and 7 communities (41,084 people) in 2 districts in Eastern and Southeastern Tigray (Irob and Enderta) which are vulnerable to climate change hazards, marginalization and distress migration. The program addresses two main target groups. First, poor, food insecure smallholders will increase and diversify their crop and livestock production and income by engaging in innovative, climate-smart (irrigated) crop agriculture and animal husbandry and by organizing themselves in farmer groups and cooperatives to improve their market access. Second, landless and marginalized households as well as unemployed youth will acquire vocational and entrepreneurial skills enabling them to find employment or to engage in sustainable income generating activities. Proper food utilization is promoted by enhancing access to potable water (construction and/or rehabilitation of water points) and by nutrition, sanitation and hygiene education. The sustainability of food and nutrition security gains will depend upon fulfilling three major conditions. First, environmental rehabilitation and conservation must be ensured, for which the program supports communities in rehabilitating, stabilizing and managing degraded watersheds. Second, households' and individuals' access to financial services must be improved, for which grassroots savings and credit institutions are strengthened. Third, young men and women and their families must be empowered to make informed decisions about migration, which the program promotes by enhancing target groups' knowledge and information on regular and irregular migration. Synergy and complementarities are pursued among others with government line offices in general and with universities and technical schools for respectively livestock feed development and vocational skills training.

title.narrative: PROG 2017-2021_Outcome3_Strengthening food and nutrition security of targeted households and communities vulnerable to climate change hazards, marginalization and distress migration through promotion of climate-smart agriculture and diversified livelihoods in the districts of Irob and Enderta (Eastern and Southeastern Tigray), Ethiopia.
Reduced Coping Strategies Index, male-headed households, Enderta

description.narrative: The Reduced Coping Strategies Index is a measure of the extent to which households rely on negative coping strategies (rely on less expensive and less preferred food, reduction of portion size, reduction of number of meals per day, etc.)

comment.narrative: The actual end value of the indicator could not be measured because of the armed conflict that broke out in Tigray in November 2020.

title.narrative: Reduced Coping Strategies Index, female-headed households, Enderta

description.narrative: The Reduced Coping Strategies Index is a measure of the extent to which households rely on negative coping strategies (rely on less expensive and less preferred food, reduction of portion size, reduction of number of meals per day, etc.)

comment.narrative: The actual end value of the indicator could not be measured because of the armed conflict that broke out in Tigray in November 2020.

title.narrative: Average number of Essential Sanitation and Hygiene Action Practices adopted by mothers, Enderta

description.narrative: The Essential Sanitation and Hygiene Action practices considered are: 1) use of safe water or treatment of unsafe water; 2) use of a latrine; 3) use of hand washing facilities; 4) use of a waste disposal pit; 5) appropriate disposal of child faeces; 6) washing of hands at two out of five critical occasions at least.

comment.narrative: The actual end value of the indicator could not be measured because of the armed conflict that broke out in Tigray in November 2020.

title.narrative: Average number of Essential Sanitation and Hygiene Action Practices adopted by mothers, Irob

description.narrative: The Essential Sanitation and Hygiene Action practices considered are: 1) use of safe water or treatment of unsafe water; 2) use of a latrine; 3) use of hand washing facilities; 4) use of a waste disposal pit; 5) appropriate disposal of child faeces; 6) washing of hands at two out of five critical occasions at least.

comment.narrative: The actual end value of the indicator could not be measured because of the armed conflict that broke out in Tigray in November 2020.

title.narrative: Average number of Essential Nutrition Practices adopted by mothers, Enderta

description.narrative: The Essential Nutrition Practices considered are: 1) initiating breastfeeding within recommended time; 2) exclusive breast feeding during the recommended number of months; 3) continued breast feeding for at least 15 months; 4) introducing supplementary feeding at the recommended period; 5) giving child the recommended number of meals; 6) giving at least 4 types of food each day; 7) increasing mother's number of meals during pregnancy; 8) increasing mother's number of meals during lactation; 9) backyard gardening; 10) poultry or small ruminants rearing.

comment.narrative: The actual end value of the indicator could not be measured because of the armed conflict that broke out in Tigray in November 2020.

title.narrative: Severely food insecure male-headed households, Enderta

description.narrative: Households' food insecurity is assessed by means of a combination of Food Consumption Score (FCS) and Food Access Score (FAS).

comment.narrative: The actual end value of the indicator could not be measured because of the armed conflict that broke out in Tigray in November 2020.
